newsitem.title: UK: NWE fuel oil flat, high sulphur finely balanced.
newsitem.headline: NWE fuel oil flat, high sulphur finely balanced.

text.p: NWE high sulphur cracked fuel was steady on Thursday amid flat crude and unchanged supply/demand factors, traders said.
High sulphur barges traded at $90.25 fob Rotterdam and $91.00 fob Antwerp while high sulphur cracked cargoes were pegged steady at $84-86 cif NWE.
Dealers said the NWE barge market was finely balanced with tight supplies matched by slim demand.
"The Russian exports have been less than expected, but the market could easily turn either way," said one.
Fuel was looking more bullish and barges consolidating past $90.00 could trigger some renewed buying. But, moves higher are likely to be capped by limited end-user interest.
"$80-90 has remained a range since late February," said one dealer.
If a deal is concluded today the level was expected to be around $85 cif NWE, on the basis of no sudden changes in crude.
Low sulphur fuel was steady with cargoes pegged around $94 fob NWE and market talk was of continued slowness in part because the main Med buyer was noticeably quiet.
